meanings.sent1: I need to launder my dirty clothes before the trip.
meanings.sent2: She always makes sure to launder her bedsheets every week.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy decided to help launder the muddy towels.
meanings.sent4: The rain helped to naturally launder the dusty car parked outside.
meanings.sent5: The gentle stream was able to launder the pebbles along its path.

meanings.definition: To illegally move money through a series of transactions to conceal its origin
meanings.sent1: Criminals often try to launder money to hide their illegal activities.
meanings.sent2: The authorities were able to trace the laundered funds back to the source.
meanings.sent3: In the movie, the villain attempted to launder his ill-gotten gains through a fake charity.
meanings.sent4: The intricate web of transactions was designed to launder the dirty money without detection.
meanings.sent5: The undercover agent worked tirelessly to uncover the money laundering scheme.

meanings.definition: A place where clothes and linens are washed
meanings.sent1: The hotel had a convenient launder for guests to use.
meanings.sent2: She dropped off her clothes at the local launder for cleaning.
meanings.sent3: The bustling city had a famous launder known for its quick service.
meanings.sent4: The old mansion had a hidden launder in the basement for washing linens.
meanings.sent5: The small town had only one launder that served the entire community.
